verses.kjv: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him to Pilate.
verses.ct: First thing in the morning, the chief priests met with the elders, the legal experts, and the entire ruling council. They had Jesus tied up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.

verses.kjv: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto him, Thou sayest it.
verses.ct: Pilate questioned him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus replied, "You have said it yourself."

verses.kjv: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.
verses.ct: The chief priests brought many accusations against him, but Jesus gave no response.

verses.kjv: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.
verses.ct: So Pilate questioned him again, "Don't you have anything to say? Look at how many charges they're bringing against you."

verses.kjv: But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.
verses.ct: But Jesus still said nothing, which amazed Pilate.

verses.kjv: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.
verses.ct: Now it was customary during the festival for Pilate to release one prisoner — whichever one the crowd requested.

verses.kjv: And there was one named Barabbas, which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him, who had committed murder in the insurrection.
verses.ct: A man named Barabbas was in prison along with other rebels who had committed murder during an uprising.

verses.kjv: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them.
verses.ct: The crowd came forward and began asking Pilate to follow his usual custom of releasing a prisoner for them.

verses.kjv: But Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
verses.ct: Pilate responded, "Do you want me to release the King of the Jews to you?"

verses.kjv: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.
verses.ct: He could tell that the chief priests had handed Jesus over out of jealousy.

verses.kjv: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
verses.ct: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to demand that he release Barabbas instead.

verses.kjv: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?
verses.ct: Pilate spoke to them again, "Then what do you want me to do with the one you call the King of the Jews?"

verses.kjv: And they cried out again, Crucify him.
verses.ct: They shouted back, "Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.
verses.ct: Pilate asked them, "Why? What crime has he committed?" But they just screamed even louder, "Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.
verses.ct: Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged and then handed him over to be crucified.

verses.kjv: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.
verses.ct: The soldiers took him inside the courtyard of the governor's headquarters, called the Praetorium, and assembled the entire regiment.

verses.kjv: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,
verses.ct: They dressed him in a purple robe, twisted together a crown of thorns, and placed it on his head.

verses.kjv: And began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!
verses.ct: Then they began mocking him with salutes, saying, "Long live the King of the Jews!"

verses.kjv: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.
verses.ct: They struck him on the head with a stick, spit on him, and dropped to their knees in fake worship.

verses.kjv: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.
verses.ct: After they finished mocking him, they stripped off the purple robe, put his own clothes back on him, and led him out to be crucified.

verses.kjv: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.
verses.ct: They forced a man passing by to carry his cross — Simon from Cyrene, who was coming in from the countryside. He was the father of Alexander and Rufus.

verses.kjv: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.
verses.ct: They brought Jesus to a place called Golgotha, which means "The Place of the Skull."

verses.kjv: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
verses.ct: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he refused to drink it.

verses.kjv: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.
verses.ct: After they crucified him, they divided up his clothes by gambling to see who would get each piece.

verses.kjv: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.
verses.ct: It was 9 in the morning when they crucified him.

verses.kjv: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.ct: A sign was posted above him stating the charge against him: THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.kjv: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.
verses.ct: They also crucified 2 criminals with him, one on his right and one on his left.

verses.kjv: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.
verses.ct: This fulfilled the Scripture that says, "He was counted among the lawbreakers."

verses.kjv: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,
verses.ct: People walking by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, "So! You were going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in 3 days!"

verses.kjv: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.
verses.ct: "Rescue yourself and come down from that cross!"

verses.kjv: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.
verses.ct: The chief priests and legal experts also ridiculed him among themselves, saying, "He rescued others, but he can't rescue himself."

verses.kjv: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reviled him.
verses.ct: "Let the Christ, the King of Israel, come down from the cross right now so we can see it and believe!" Even the men crucified alongside him insulted him.

verses.kjv: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.ct: At noon, darkness covered the entire land and lasted until 3 in the afternoon.

verses.kjv: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
verses.ct: At 3 in the afternoon, Jesus cried out loudly, "Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?" — which means, "My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?"

verses.kjv: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.
verses.ct: Some of the people standing nearby heard this and said, "Listen — he's calling for Elijah."

verses.kjv: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.
verses.ct: One person ran and soaked a sponge in sour wine, put it on a stick, and held it up for him to drink, saying, "Wait — let's see if Elijah comes to take him down."

verses.kjv: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
verses.ct: Then Jesus let out a loud cry and took his last breath.

verses.kjv: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.
verses.ct: The curtain in the temple was torn in 2 from top to bottom.

verses.kjv: And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
verses.ct: The Roman officer standing right in front of him saw how he died and said, "This man truly was the Son of God."

verses.kjv: There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
verses.ct: A number of women were watching from a distance, including Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and Joses, and Salome.

verses.kjv: (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
verses.ct: These women had followed him and supported him when he was in Galilee. Many other women who had traveled with him to Jerusalem were there as well.

verses.kjv: And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
verses.ct: That evening — since it was Preparation Day, the day before the Sabbath —

verses.kjv: Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.
verses.ct: Joseph of Arimathaea, a respected member of the council who was himself looking forward to the kingdom of God, gathered his courage, went to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

verses.kjv: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
verses.ct: Pilate was surprised that Jesus could already be dead. He summoned the Roman officer and asked whether Jesus had been dead for some time.

verses.kjv: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
verses.ct: Once the officer confirmed it, Pilate released the body to Joseph.

verses.kjv: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
verses.ct: Joseph purchased a linen cloth, took the body down, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb that had been carved out of rock. Then he rolled a stone across the entrance of the tomb.

verses.kjv: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
verses.ct: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses watched carefully to see where he was placed.
